result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken
Filed by Atty Todd Bennett

Defendant Jeremy Cook in court with attorney Todd W. Bennett.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 days in jail, with Huber work release.  $868.00 fines/costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Submit DNA sample.  1 day jail credit.  Jail start 6-10-16 at 7:00 pm.  4:00/
